issue.title: Orbit view controller movement swapped for X/Y hotkeys

content.raw:
Ohh I see, so we have 2 frames of reference, the world frame (indicated by the RGB lines) and the camera frame, where the Z is vertical, Y is horizontal and X points into the screen.

The camera motion is always happening in the world frame, so the camera will move parallel to the RGB lines independently of where you're looking from.

But the mouse motion seems to be calculated in the camera frame, that's why the motion only makes sense when looking from the angle you showed (camera and world frames aligned).

Drag direction | Direction on camera frame | Camera translation on world frame
-- | -- | --
Top of screen | +Z | -X / no effect for Y / -Z
Bottom of screen | -Z | +X / no effect for Y / +Z
Right of screen | -Y | no effect for X / +Y / no effect for Z
Left of screen | +Y | no effect for X / -Y / no effect for Z
